docs/changelist.md
1 Changelist
2 ============
3 
4 ### 1.6.0
5  * Fixed an issue where \ref RAIL_RfStateGet() would mistakenly return
6  \ref RAIL_RF_STATE_IDLE instead of \ref RAIL_RF_STATE_TX when a
7  Transmit operation's LBT is active.
8  * Added an API (RAIL_SetAbortScheduledTxDuringRx) that sets the behavior
9  when a scheduled TX fires during an RX or ACK. If the API is passed false,
10  TX's will be delayed until the RX (or ACK to the RX) is complete. That
11  behavior is the default and what always happened previously. Passing the
12  function true however will abort scheduled TX's that fire during the RX
13  (or ACK to the RX) and fire the RAILCb_TxRadioStatus callback.
14  * Added new RAILCb_AssertFailed callback to give the flexible handling of
15  asserts within RAIL. This includes defines of assert codes and error
16  reasons in rail_assert_error_codes.h. The default implementation hangs in
17  an infinite loop.
18  * Added RAIL_ENUM define to override enum size ambuiguity in the ARM EABI by
19  making them actually a uint8_t. For documentation purposes they are still
20  shown as enums.
21  * Added new TX options: removeCrc, to override whether CRC is sent; and
22  syncWordId, to choose which SYNC word to transmit when multiple SYNC words
23  are configured.
24  * Added new RX option: RAIL_RX_OPTION_ENABLE_DUALSYNC, which allows multiple
25  SYNC words to be searched for on PHYs that support it.
26  * Added RAIL_PeekRxPacket to allow reading part of a packet before it has
27  been fully received.
28  * Changed BER Test functionality in RAILTest such that if a RX overflow is
29  detected (due to the incoming datarate being too high), the test now aborts
30  and displays an appropriate status message.
31  * Fixed an issue where the code could hang in a RX overflow state when
32  receiving incoming data streams.
33  * RAIL_TxToneStart() and RAIL_TxStreamStart() now idle the radio before
34  transmitting.
35  * Fixed an issue where calling RAIL_TimerSet() while in the middle of a
36  stream or tone transmission could lock up the radio.
37  * Added new frequency offset related functions, RAIL_GetRxFreqOffset and
38  RAIL_SetFreqOffset, and the associated \ref RAIL_FrequencyOffset_t type
39  definition.
40 
41 ### 1.5.2
42  * Fixed an issue in 1.5.1 that would cause scheduled receive, scheduled
43  transmit, and RAIL timer operations to fail on EFR32xG12 with a relative
44  delay of 0.
45  * Fixed an issue in 1.5.1 that would cause scheduled receive and scheduled
46  transmit to fail if called with an absolute time from [0, rxWarmTime) or
47  [0, txWarmTime) respectively.
48  * Fixed an issue where a failed scheduled transmit operation would prevent
49  any transmit from succeeding until \ref RAIL_RfIdle() or
50  \ref RAIL_RfIdleExt() were called.
51  * Fixed an issue in 1.5.1 where calling idle while looking for an ACK could
52  cause the radio to get stuck in the receive state.
53 
54 ### 1.5.1
55  * Added official support for the EFR32xG12 parts through a new
56  librail_efr32xg12.a version of the library.
57  * Added RAIL_SetRxOptions API for configuration of receive options, such as
58  RAIL_RX_OPTION_STORE_CRC.
59  * Increase transmit and receive fifo sizes to 512 bytes for all EFR32xG1
60  parts. This impacts both packet and fifo modes.
61  * Added \ref RAIL_RxDataSource_t::RX_DEMOD_DATA in order to receive
62  demodulated data via FIFO method.
63  * Shortened the duration that the transmit buffer lock in RAIL_TxDataLoad()
64  is held, as it was overprotective. RAIL will still report an error if the
65  application attempts to manipulate the transmit buffer while actively
66  transmitting data.
67  * Improved state transition timings for enhanced precision and accuracy. To
68  improve precision we have switched to a more stable receive complete event
69  since our previous trigger could jitter for certain radio configurations. To
70  improve accuracy we measured and removed PHY specific overhead for BLE
71  applications. Note that this measurement was BLE specific and does _not_
72  completely correct accuracy on any arbitrary PHY configuration. For custom
73  PHY configurations you will still have to manually calibrate out any offsets
74  by measurement and any previous measurements are likely different now.
75  * Moved BER test implementation out of the RAIL library and into RAILTest.
76  Deprecated the existing BER test functions in the RAIL API. With BER test
77  code now existing in RAILTest, you must use version 2.2.1 or later of the
78  radio configurator.
79  * Disabled receive buffer overflow and transmit buffer underflow as
80  BUFC_IRQHandler() events. These events now only occur in FRC_IRQHandler().
81  * Sped up RAIL transmit and receive buffer read/write operations.
82  * Fixed a race condition that could cause the receive packet callback to be
83  delayed until the next receive packet event.
84 
85 ### 1.5.0
86  * Added other methods of \ref Data_Management. The application can
87  configure RAIL to provide/retrieve data via FIFO method.
88  * The new FIFO method of data management brings with it two new callbacks:
89  RAILCb_TxFifoAlmostEmpty(), and RAILCb_RxFifoAlmostFull(). Note that you
90  must implement these new callbacks or stub them out if you do not intend to
91  use them.
92 
93 ### 1.4.2
94  * Fixed a bug in how we handled IEEE 802.15.4 data request packets.
95  Specifically, we were not issuing the
96  RAILCb_IEEE802154_DataRequestCommand() callback for data request packets
97  that were sent with MAC security enabled.
98  * Fixed a bug where calling RAIL_TxDataLoad() at an inopportune time could
99  cause that and all subsequent such calls to fail.
100 
101 ### 1.4.1
102  * Implemented LQI measurement. The field in RAIL_AppendedInfo_t is now
103  populated on every packet receive.
104  * Allow transmit while receive is active, if the channel is the same. After
105  transmitting, the radio will follow the configured state transitions as
106  before.
107  * Allow shorter ccaBackoff times if receive is active during the CSMA or LBT
108  process.
109  * Allow calling RAIL_RxConfig while receiving.
110  * Added new receive event: RAIL_RX_CONFIG_PACKET_ABORTED
111  * Added new RAIL_TxConfig API, along with more transmit events:
112  RAIL_TX_CONFIG_CHANNEL_CLEAR, RAIL_TX_CONFIG_CCA_RETRY,
113  RAIL_TX_CONFIG_START_CCA
114  * Fixed a filtering bug in the IEEE 802.15.4 code. We were incorrectly filtering
115  packets with a 0xFFFF source PANID while the coordinator which caused
116  problems in the joining process. The new logic will only use the source
117  PANID for filtering if we are the coordinator, there is no destination
118  address, and the frame type is MAC command or Data.
119  * Migrated to Gecko SDK 5.0, including the new em_core APIs for interrupt
120  enabling and disabling. This adds required dependencies on the
121  CORE_EnterCritical() and CORE_ExitCritical() functions.
122  * Added new RSSI functions for hardware and software averaging:
123  RAIL_StartAverageRSSI(), RAIL_GetAverageRSSI(), RAIL_AverageRSSIReady(),
124  RAIL_PollAverageRSSI().
125  * Added new RSSI callback: RAILCb_RssiAverageDone().
126  * Added the ability to switch between multiple BLE phys, including 2Mbps phys,
127  on chips that support the new phys.
128 
129 ### 1.4.0
130  * Added support for the EFR32MG12P part family with larger RAM and Flash size
131  variants along with some new chip features.
132  * Renamed anything that was just efr32 in the previous releases to efr32xg1 to
133  differentiate it from the new efr32xg12 family of parts.
134  * Add support for the new BLE 2MBit PHY to the BLE acceleration and
135  configuration APIs on EFR32xG12 chips.
136  * Better optimize IR Calibration run times for all EFR32xG1 parts. You must
137  use version 0.69 or later of the radio configurator.
138 
139 ### 1.3.2
140  * Added RAIL_SetPtiProtocol() and \ref RAIL_PtiProtocol_t. This function
141  allows the application to configure RAIL's packet trace interface to output
142  protocol specific data.
143  * Fix BER functions to operate at 1Mbps data rates.
144  * RAIL_RfIdle() does not clear the transmit buffer anymore. RAIL_TxDataLoad()
145  resets the transmit buffer with every packet set. This fixes the case where
146  RAIL_RfIdle() is called after RAIL_TxDataLoad().
147  * Fixed bug when using fixed packet lengths configured via the Radio
148  Configurator. RAIL_TxStart() will not overwrite the configured fixed
149  length to the amount of data loaded by RAIL_TxDataLoad().
150  * Fixed bug in RADIO_PA_Init() where ramp times greater than 11.2 ms would be
151  truncated to a very short ramp.
152 
153 ### 1.3.1
154  * Added IEEE 802.15.4 hardware acceleration. The new APIs can be found in
155  protocol/ieee802154/rail_ieee802154.h. Documentation for these APIs can be
156  found in \ref IEEE802_15_4. This includes a new callback:
157  RAILCb_IEEE802154_DataRequestCommand().
158  * Added Auto Ack hardware acceleration. Documentation for these APIs
159  can be found in \ref Auto_Ack.
160  * Added RAIL_TxStartWithOptions(). This new API takes a pointer to \ref
161  RAIL_TxOptions_t that contains options to modify the upcoming transmit.
162  * Increased minimum state transition time to 100 us.
163  * Added \ref RAIL_STATUS_INVALID_CALL
164  * Added \ref RAIL_AppendedInfo_t::isAck
165 
166 ### 1.3.0
167  * Added BLE hardware acceleration. The new APIs can be found in
168  protocol/ble/rail_ble.h. Documentation for these APIs can be found in \ref
169  BLE.
170  * Added RAIL_ScheduleRx() and \ref RAIL_ScheduleRxConfig_t. This allows the
171  application to schedule a RX window using the RAIL timebase.
172  * Added \ref RAIL_TIME_DISABLED enum to \ref RAIL_TimeMode_t.
173  * Added an extended idle function which gives you more control of how the
174  radio is idled. See RAIL_RfIdleExt() and \ref RAIL_RfIdleMode_t for more
175  details.
176  * Added \ref RAIL_RX_CONFIG_TIMEOUT and \ref RAIL_RX_CONFIG_SCHEDULED_RX_END
177  * Added \ref RAIL_TX_CONFIG_TX_ABORTED and \ref RAIL_TX_CONFIG_TX_BLOCKED
178  * Added an extended radio status callback that supports up to 32 different
179  status reasons (RAILCb_RxRadioStatusExt()). You may implement this
180  instead of RAILCb_RxRadioStatus() or continue using the old version if
181  you do not need access to more than the first 8 status values.
182 
183 ### 1.2.7
184  * Added FEM control signals
185  * Added RAIL_SetPaCTune in order to tune the PA capacitor value for TX and RX.
186  * Fix typo in RAIL_StreamMode_t : PSUEDO_RANDOM_STREAM to PSEUDO_RANDOM_STREAM
187 
188 ### 1.2.6
189  * Added ability to reset demod.
190 
191 ### 1.2.5
192  * Fixed register settings for BER testing.
193  * Fixed packet buffer for contents larger than 170 bytes.
194 
195 ### 1.2.4
196  * Presented worst case RfSense wake period
197 
198 ### 1.2.3
199  * Optimized address filtering code for operation at higher data rates.
200  * Clarified data rate limitations of address filtering.
201 
202 ### 1.2.2
203  * Added RAIL_SetTime() in order to allow the user to change the RAIL
204  timebase with microsecond granularity.
205  * Removed sprurious calls to RAIL_RxRadioStatus() with the \ref
206  RAIL_RX_CONFIG_BUFFER_OVERFLOW argument, which were happening when receive
207  was aborted due to events such as address filtering failures.
208  * Fixed incorrect PA output power calculations.
209 
210 ### 1.2.1
211  * Allow RAIL_RxStart() and RAIL_TxStart() to not error if the radio is
212  heading to idle after a call to RAIL_RfIdle(). Application code does not
213  have to wait until the radio is completely idle before calling a receive or
214  transmit operation as long as the radio is heading to idle.
215 
216 ### 1.2.0
217  * Fixed IR calibration such that calibration values are more accurate for
218  radio configurations with datarates below 10Kbps.
219  * Fixed IR calibration such that the default calibration value is applied
220  when a better calibration value is unable to be calculated.
221  * Added RAIL_CalInit() for calibration initialization.
222  * Added BER test API and structures for diagnostic use -
223  RAIL_BerConfigSet(), RAIL_BerRxStart(), RAIL_BerRxStop(),
224  RAIL_BerStatusGet(), \ref RAIL_BerConfig_t, \ref RAIL_BerStatus_t.
225  * Enabled DC Calibration during initialization.
226 
227 ### 1.1.1
228  * Fixed CCA timing to prevent invalid CCA failures when starting out of IDLE
229  state.
230  * Fixed RX state transitions to TX when ignoring CRC errors. Will properly take
231  the success route when a CRC error occurs while ignoring CRC errors.
232  * Fixed TX error state transition after CCA failure.
233 
234 ### 1.1.0
235  * RAIL_RX_CONFIG_INVALID_CRC changed to \ref RAIL_RX_CONFIG_FRAME_ERROR
236  * This now accurately represents the callback flag.
237  * A frame error is either an invalid crc, a frame coding error, or a
238  variable length error. On detection of a frame error, the radio will
239  proceed to the defined error state.
240  * RAIL_SetRxTransitions() and RAIL_SetTxTransitions() APIs added
241  * Add ability to configure radio to automatically to transition to a
242  given radio state on completion of a receive or transmit event.
243  * RAIL_SetStateTiming() API added
244  * State transition times can be configured. The given timestamps will not
245  perfectly match on-air times, due to the RX and TX chain delays, which
246  are dependent on the radio configuration.
247  * RAIL_AddressFilterByFrameType() added
248  * If address filtering and frame type length decoding are both enabled,
249  this gives the ability to enable or disable address filtering per frame
250  type
251 
252 ### 1.0.0
253  * Return quarter dBm resolution from RAIL_RxGetRSSI(). This changes the return
254  value to an int16_t from an int8_t.
255  * Added calibration APIs (\ref Calibration)
256  * The RAIL library will notify the application via callback,
257  RAILCb_CalNeeded(), whenever it detects a calibration is needed.
258  * An API is provided allowing the application to choose when to calibrate
259  the radio, to pass in a known calibration value, or force a calibration
260  to occur.
261  * RAIL_TxPowerSet() returns the power level that can be set which might not
262  match the requested power level.
263 
264 ### Beta 1 - November 16, 2015
265  * Exposed EFR32 RF Energy Sensing capability via a RAIL API.
266  * This functionality allows the radio to be woken from sleep by a large
267  amount of energy over the air.
268  * Added new RAIL Timer APIs (\ref System_Timing)
269  * This provides access to a hardware timer running at the RAIL timebase. You
270  can use this to implement simple protocol timing that may be needed by
271  your low level radio code.
272  * This change also adds a new RAILCb_TimerExpired() that must be implemented
273  by your application.
274  * Added APIs to access the bit rate and symbol rate for the current PHY
275  (RAIL_BitRateGet(), RAIL_SymbolRateGet()).
276  * Cleaned up RAIL type names so that they all begin with the RAIL_ prefix.
277  This will require updates to existing application code.
278  * Initial integration with Simplicity Studio's application builder tools
279 
280 ### Alpha 2 - September 14, 2015
281  * Filtering of receive packets based on defined address fields and compare
282  values. See \ref Address_Filtering for more details.
283  * Added different \ref Pre-Transmit options for the Tx function.
284  * Scheduling of packet transmission at an absolute time or after a defined
285  delay.
286  * Packet transmission conditional on Clear Channel Assessment (CSMA, LBT).
287  * The ability to read RSSI manually with RAIL_RxGetRSSI().
288  * Support for building RAIL applications using both GCC and IAR toolchains.
289 
290 ### Alpha 1
291  * Initial release with support for transmit receive and basic radio
292  configuration.
